questions.question:
Question 1: You notice the following instrument being used to monitor a primigravida in the first stage of 
labor. What is the investigation being performed here?
questions.explanation:
The image shows a cardiotocograph (electronic fetal monitor) that is used to perform 
cardiotocography in labor. It can be used in both antenatal and intranatal mothers. It measures fetal heart rate and uterine 
contractions. It is used to perform the non-stress test (NST) in the antenatal period and 
cardiotocography during labor.

questions.question:
Question 2: During your OBG posting, one of the senior residents asks you to induce labor in a 
primigravida admitted at 40 weeks of gestation. Identify the following device that you can use 
for this purpose. 864 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
This is an image of cervidil vaginal insert. It is used for cervical ripening and improves the 
Bishop's score. It contains 10 mg of dinoprostone designed to release at a rate of approximately 0.3 mg/hr over 
10-hours.

questions.question:
Question 3: The following instrument is used to augment labour in a 28-year-old primigravida via low 
rupture of membranes. Identify this instrument.
questions.explanation:
879 
Sold by @itachibot The given instrument is Kocher's artery forceps and is identified by the presence of a single tooth 
at the tip. Kocher's artery forceps are used to achieve hemostasis by holding bleeding vessels. They are also 
used in low rupture of membranes to augment labour or for the surgical induction of labour. The difference between artery forceps and needle holders is in the edge and smoothness of 
corrugations. Artery forceps have smooth edges and single lined corrugations whereas, needle 
holders have rough edges and crossed lines forming square to diamond shaped corrugations.

questions.question:
Question 4: A primigravida was diagnosed with a prolonged second stage of labor due to the fetus being 
in occipitoposterior position. The obstetrician decided to give a posterior mediolateral cut at 
the introitus to facilitate delivery. Which of the following instruments would she use for the 
same?
questions.explanation:
The given scenario of prolonged second stage of labor can be managed by performing an 
episiotomy. In the given figure, the instrument marked as "D" corresponds to episiotomy scissors. An episiotomy is done to prevent posterior extention leading to obstetric anal sphincteric injuries.

questions.question:
Question 5: The following instrument is used on an exhausted primigravida during crowning of the fetal 
head. Which of the following is false about this instrument? 866 
Sold by @itachibot

options.a: It can be used in caesarean sections.
options.b: It can be used to deliver aftercoming head in breech.
options.c: It is a type of outlet forceps.

questions.explanation:
The given image shows Wrigley's forceps. These are used as outlet forceps for the extraction of the fetal head. It is used to provide traction 
force. It can also be used in C-section for delivery of the baby. The instrument is light and short due to a reduction in the length of the shanks and handles. It 
has a marked cephalic curve with a slight pelvic curve. Conditions that require to be fulfilled for the use of outlet forceps are: • The fetal scalp is visible without separating the labia (crowning) • The fetal skull has reached the pelvic floor, or is on the perineum 880 
Sold by @itachibot • The sagittal suture is in the anteroposterior diameter or right or left occiput anterior or posterior 
position (rotation does not exceed 45°) Note: Delivery of aftercoming head in breech is done with Pipers forceps.

questions.question:
Question 6: While assisting in the caesarean section of a multigravida, you see the senior obstetrician 
using the following instrument. Identify it.
questions.explanation:
The given instrument is Green-Armytage forceps. Its tips are broad and hence can compress a wide area. During lower segment caesarean section 
(LSCS), these forceps are applied at the bleeding cut uterine edges for hemostasis.

questions.question:
Question 7: An obstetrician performs an aspiration of the endometrial cavity in a woman with complaints 
of a missed period 2 weeks back. Identify the following instrument. What is the procedure it 
is used for?
questions.explanation:
The instrument is Karman’s cannula and syringe, which is also used for menstrual regulation. Menstrual regulation is the aspiration of the endometrial cavity within 14 days of a missed period 
in a woman with a previous normal cycle. Under aseptic precautions, the cervix may be gently dilated using 4-5 mm size dilators. Then 
5-6mm Karman’s cannula is inserted and attached to a 50ml syringe for suction. The cannula is 
rotated, and pushed in and out with gentle strokes. This procedure is contraindicated in advanced pregnancy and in the presence of local pelvic 
inflammation. The drawbacks of the procedure include a missed implanted zygote or an 
unrecognized ectopic pregnancy. This procedure is not commonly done anymore.

questions.question:
Question 8: A 20-year-old woman at 9 weeks of gestation comes to the clinic for check-up following an 
MTP. On ultrasound, retained tissue was found and the following instrument was used for its 
removal. What is this instrument? 868 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
The image shows a manual vacuum aspiration (MVA) syringe. Manual vacuum aspiration can be safely done upto 12 weeks of gestation. However, WHO 
recommends it as the procedure of choice for MTP only upto 10 weeks of gestation . The indications of this procedure are given as follows: • Medical termination of pregnancy • Incomplete abortion or missed abortion • Molar pregnancy • Endometrial aspiration 881 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question:
Question 9: Identify the following instrument that is commonly used in a dilatation and curettage 
procedure.
questions.explanation:
The given image shows Hegar's double-ended dilator which is used to dilate the cervix in dilation 
and curettage procedure. Pratt dilator is also a double-ended dilator but has a more linear shape as compared to the curved 
Hegar's dilators. The image given below shows a Pratt dilator. Option A: Hawkin dilator is a single-ended dilator. The image given below shows a Hawkin 
dilator. 882 
Sold by @itachibot Option C: Bakes rosebud dilator is a single-ended dilator used to dilate the urethra. It is called so 
since its tip is similar to a rosebud. The image given below shows a Bakes dilator. Option D: Fenton dilator is also double-ended but it has a notch in the middle. The image given 
below shows a Fenton dilator. 883 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question:
Question 10: A 25-year-old woman presents with dyspareunia due to scarring secondary to perineal tears 
from previous vaginal delivery. The gynaecologist advises the use of the following dilator to 
widen the introitus. Identify this instrument.
questions.explanation:
The image shows a Fenton dilator. These can be identified by the neck/notch at the centre. Fenton's or modified Fenton's procedure is performed to widen the introitus in women with 
superficial dyspareunia secondary to scarring. The narrowing of introitus could be due to scarring 
secondary to perineal tears during childbirth or from conditions such as lichen sclerosus or 
vestibulitis. Fenton dilators come in sizes numbered from 3-10 and the sizes of the dilators range from 3mm 
to 26mm. Option B: Hawkins dilator is single-ended. Options A and C: Hegar and Pratt dilators are also double-ended dilators but they do not have a 
notch at the centre. Pratt dilator is more linear in appearance compared to Hegar dilator.

questions.question:
Question 11: You have posted a 43-year-old woman with abnormal uterine bleeding for dilatation and 
curettage in the minor OT. Identify the following instrument used in this procedure. 870 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
The instrument shown in the image is Sim's curette. It is a single-ended uterine curette used for 
dilatation and curettage. It is designed to remove tough tissue from the lining of the uterus for biopsy or excision. The 
curette features a sharp loop tip to aid in the removal of the uterine tissue. 884 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question: Question 12: The following instrument is used for all except:
questions.explanation:
The image shows a double-ended uterine curette with a sharp and a blunt end. It is not used in 
uterine length measurement. Uterine length measurement is done with a uterine sound which is given below.

questions.question: Question 13: Which of the following is a false statement about the instrument given below?

options.a: It measures the uterine cavity and the cervical length
options.b: It differentiates between chronic inversion and fibroid polyp
options.c: It retracts the posterior vaginal wall to expose the cervix
options.d: It is used to diagnose cervical stenosis

questions.explanation:
The given instrument is Simpson’s uterine sound. It is not used to retract the vagina for cervical 
examination. This is done using Sim's speculum. 885 
Sold by @itachibot The instrument is held like a pencil with the thumb and the first 2 fingers and introduced into the 
uterine cavity by keeping it in the midline and ensuring it is not forced. The uses are given as follows: • To measure uterine cavity and cervical length • To diagnose cervical stenosis • To sound a polyp, IUCD or uterine septum • To break adhesions • To differentiate between chronic inversion and fibroid polyp

questions.question:
Question 14: You see a resident use the following instrument to grasp the anterior lip of the cervix in a 
patient posted for a vaginal hysterectomy. What is this instrument known as? 872 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
The image shows vulsellum forceps. It is used to grasp the cervical lip and steady the cervix 
during vaginal surgery. It is a long instrument with a gentle curve so that the line of vision is not 
obstructed. Option A: Allis forceps can be identified by continuous teeth, equal on both ends. It is used to hold 
structures with a firm grip. Option C: Kocher's artery forceps are non-traumatic with a single tooth at the tip. They help in 
achieving hemostasis by firm pressure. Option D: Lahey's tissue grasping forceps has teeth similar to dinner forks. They are used to hold 
fibrous tissue and they give a firm grip without slippage.

questions.question: Question 15: Identify the following instrument.
questions.explanation:
886 
Sold by @itachibot The given instrument is a towel-holding clip. It is used to secure drapings and towels during 
surgery. Sponge-holding forceps are non-traumatic forceps. They are used for painting and preparation of 
parts preoperatively. Filshie clips are used for laparoscopic tubal sterilisation. They are made of titanium on the outer 
side and sialistic material on the inner side.

questions.question:
Question 16: You are assisting a case of vaginal hysterectomy where your assistant professor asks you to 
hold the retractor shown in the image. What is this retractor known as?
questions.explanation:
The image shown is that of a Simon vaginal retractor, used to retract vaginal walls during 
examination and vaginal procedures. The below image is of Doyen's retractor. It is used during abdominal procedures like C-section. 887 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question:
Question 17: Identify the instrument. 874 
Sold by @itachibot
questions.explanation:
The instrument shown in the image is Auvard speculum. It retracts the posterior vaginal wall 
during vaginal hysterectomy and is self retractory due to the circular structure on its handle which 
is heavy. The image given below shows Sim's speculum. The image given below shows Cusco's self retaining bivalved speculum. 888 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question:
Question 18: Your senior resident uses the following instrument while performing a pap smear test for 
screening of cervical cancer in a 36-year-old woman. Identify the same.
questions.explanation:
The image shows an endocervical brush. It is used to collect samples from the endocervix cervix, 
especially from deep lesions. Option A: Cervex brush is ideal for collecting samples for liquid-based cytological studies. Option C: Ayres spatula is used to collect samples from the ectocervix and the endocervix for 
cytological studies. Option D: Aylesbury spatula has a sharper and longer tip than Ayers spatula.

questions.question:
Question 19: A 32-year-old working IT professional came for a mobile cervical cancer screening camp 
planned at her workplace. What is the following instrument used to perform this screening 
test?
questions.explanation:
The given instrument used in the patient's pap smear preparation is Ayre's spatula. Sharpness on the end can differentiate between Ayre's and Aylesbury spatula. Aylesbury spatula 
has a more sharp and longer tip than Ayer's spatula. So, Aylesbury spatula is superior to Ayre's in 
collecting endocervical samples. The image given below shows a slide holding bottle i.e. Kopliks jar with Ayre's spatula. 889 
Sold by @itachibot

questions.question:
Question 20: A 35-year-old lady who had tested positive for HPV is undergoing an investigation where the 
following device is used. Which of the following statements is false about this investigation? 876 
Sold by @itachibot

options.b: It is used in lithotomy position
options.c: Green filter is used to study vascular pattern
options.d: External os is visualised at a distance of 50 cm

questions.explanation:
The device shown in the image is a colposcope. It is used to perform colposcopy where the cervix 
is visualized at a distance of around 20 cm with the patient in the lithotomy position. This instrument provides binocular vision with a magnification of 6x-15x. A green filter is used to 
study vascular pattern as the vessels appear black. Abnormal areas can be identified by their 
peculiar vascular pattern such as mosaic, reticular, and punctate.

questions.question:
Question 21: The following instrument is used for a young lady with fibroids posted for open myomectomy. 
Identify it.
questions.explanation:
The given image shows a Doyen myoma screw. It is used to perform an open myomectomy. The handle present in this can be used to distinguish 
it from a laparoscopic myoma screw which also has a similar tip.

questions.question: Question 22: Identify the use of the instrument given below:

options.b: For ligation of uterine artery during hysterectomy

questions.explanation:
The given instrument is a fallope ring applicator. It is used in tubal ligation. Falope ring sterilization is accomplished by applying silicone rubber bands to the fallopian tubes. 
The major advantage is the elimination of thermocoagulation. The occlusion is only in a short 
segment and can allow for tubal reconstruction. 890 
Sold by @itachibot
